author: jimmygchen
content:
Does `MAX_CELLS_IN_EXTENDED_MATRIX` need to be a config value? 
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/_features/eip7594/das-core.md#data-size

It's based on `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK` and would need to be increased as well when we increase blob count. May not be an issue (we're not using it atm), but thought worth checking here

author: jtraglia
content: No not really. That's an artifact of `ExtendedMatrix` which no longer exists. Right now, the config value is used to define the return type for two functions. We could change them to return a `Sequence[MatrixEntry]` instead. Does Lighthouse use an "extended matrix" similar to the spec?

author: jimmygchen
content: We don't use the intermediate type at the moment, and just transform returned the cells and proofs into `DataColumnSidecars` directly

author: jtraglia
content: Makes sense. I think most clients do something like that. That configuration value is specific to the spec's implementation, which isn't necessarily the best way to do things.
